Constructor Detail

SlicePeer

public SlicePeer(java.lang.String _name,
                 Pie _owner,
                 int _peers,
                 int _cardinal,
                 boolean _isLocal,
                 java.awt.Color _color,
                 java.lang.String _hostAddress,
                 javax.jmdns.ServiceInfo _si,
                 boolean doCreation)
Create a new peer

Parameters:
_name - the name of the peer
_owner - the owning SVGDocument
_peers - the number of present peers
_cardinal - the relative position of this peer
_isLocal - is this peer the local peer?
_color - the color of the peer
_hostAddress - the host address for this slice
_si - the service info for this peer
doCreation - whether we should do creation in the constructor

public void create()
The second stage cration. This should be called in Batik updater manager.

Has this slice been created and displayed in the pie?

Returns:
true if it is created and visisble, false otherwise

                        int _cardinal)
Set the position of this peer, relative to other peers

Parameters:
_peers - the nubmer of present peers
_cardinal - the relative position of this peer, in the range from 1 to _peers

addFile

public Dot addFile(java.io.File file,
                   java.awt.Point p)
Add a new file

Parameters:
file - a file from the local file system
p - the location of the file
Returns:
the Dot. If there was no file with the name, then the dot is a newly created dot. Otherwise, it is the existing dot updated with the new location.

addFile

public Dot addFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                   double radius,
                   double angle)
Add a new file

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file
radius - the relative radius of the file
angle - the relative angle of the file
Returns:
the Dot. If there was no file with the name, then the dot is a newly created dot. Otherwise, it is the existing dot updated with the new location.

moveFile

public Dot moveFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                    double radius,
                    double angle)
Move an existing file

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file
radius - the new relative radius of the file
angle - the new relative angle of the file
Returns:
the Dot if the file is successfully moved, null if there is no such file

getPersistentFiles

public java.util.List getPersistentFiles()
Get a list of persistent files

Returns:
a list that contains persistent files for this peer. The list is empty if this peer has not persistent files.

changeDotSize

public void changeDotSize(boolean shrink)
Change the dots' size

Parameters:
shrink - if true, reduce the size (by 10%). if false, enlarge the size (by 10%)

fileAdded

public boolean fileAdded(java.lang.String fileName,
                         double radius,
                         double angle)
The peer has added a file

Specified by:
fileAdded in interface Peer
Parameters:
fileName - the name of the newly added file
radius - the relative radius (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file. This might be null if another application creates the file
angle - the relative angle (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file. This might be null if another application creates the file
Returns:
true if there was not such a file, false otherwise

fileMoved

public boolean fileMoved(java.lang.String fileName,
                         double radius,
                         double angle)
The peer has moved a file

Specified by:
fileMoved in interface Peer
Parameters:
fileName - the name of the newly moved file
radius - the new relative radius (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file
angle - the new relative angle (between 0 and 1) of the newly added file
Returns:
true if there was not such a file, false otherwise

Specified by:
fileRemoved in interface Peer

fileName - the name of the newly removed file
Returns:
